channel.title: Updates: Public Housing Inspections [Records Request]
channel.description: Updates on the Data Liberation Project's Public Housing Inspections request

item.title: Appeal Filed Re. Constructive Denial
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On March 20, 2023, the Cornell Law School First Amendment Clinic sent HUD a letter appealing the “constructive denial” of this request, based on the agency’s undue delays. “This appeal is necessary because HUD has not issued a determination within either 20 working days of receipt of the Request or the 10-working-day maximum extension provided for under 5 U.S.C. Â§ 552(a)(6)(B)(i). […] HUD has not yet issued any determination of whether it will grant the Request. Neither has HUD plausibly set forth any ‘unusual circumstances’ that would have justified a ten-working-day extension under 5 U.S.C. Â§ 552(a)(6)(B)(i), much less any ’exceptional circumstances’ under which a court may allow HUD additional time to complete its review under 5 U.S.C. Â§ 552(a)(6)(C)(i).” HUD has assigned the appeal tracking number 23-A-HQ-00026.

item.title: Request Acknowledged
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On September 29, 2022, HUD emailed an acknowledgment letter ðŸ“„ regarding this request. The letter notes: “The Department is in the process of making a determination on fees. Once we receive a search back from the program area, we will inform you of the fee waiver decision.”
